--- title: "Systematic review and meta-analysis of Real-World Evidence" authors: - name: Dimitris Mavridis affiliations: - ref: ioannina - name: Thomas Debray orcid: 0000-0002-1790-2719 affiliations: - ref: smartdas affiliations: - id: smartdas name: Smart Data Analysis and Statistics B.V. city: Utrecht - id: ioannina name: University of Ioannina city: Ioannina format: html: toc: true number-sections: true execute: cache: true bibliography: 'https://api.citedrive.com/bib/0d25b38b-db8f-43c4-b934-f4e2f3bd655a/references.bib?x=eyJpZCI6ICIwZDI1YjM4Yi1kYjhmLTQzYzQtYjkzNC1mNGUyZjNiZDY1NWEiLCAidXNlciI6ICIyNTA2IiwgInNpZ25hdHVyZSI6ICI0MGFkYjZhMzYyYWE5Y2U0MjQ2NWE2ZTQzNjlhMWY3NTk5MzhhNzUxZDNjYWIxNDlmYjM4NDgwOTYzMzY5YzFlIn0=/bibliography.bib' --- ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_ba531256ba5161c294d52b2c63cbe000'} ::: ## Introduction We first load the required packages ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_687af4d7dc1ee383fa1bbf5d9274e104'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) library(netmeta) ``` ::: ## Advanced Therapies for Ulcerative Colitis In this example, we consider a systematic literature review of Phase 3 randomized controlled trials investigating the following advanced therapies: infliximab, adalimumab, vedolizumab, golimumab, tofacitinib, ustekinumab, filgotinib, ozanimod, and upadacitinib [@panaccione_efficacy_2023]. This review included 48 RCTs, from which 23 were found eligible for inclusion in a network meta-analysis. The included RCT populations were largely comparable in their baseline characteristics, though some heterogeneity was noted in weight, disease duration, extent of disease, and concomitant medications. A risk of bias assessment showed a low risk of bias for all included RCTs, which were all industry sponsored. ### Example Dataset We here focus on the synthesis of 18 trials that contributed efficacy data for induction in bio-naive populations. The following FDA- and/or EMA-approved biologic or SMD doses were investigated: * Adalimumab subcutaneous 160 mg at week 0, 80 mg at week 2, and 40 mg at week 4 (`ADA160/80`) * Infliximab intravenous 5 mg/kg (`INF5`) at weeks 0, 2, and 6 then every 8 weeks * Infliximab intravenous 10 mg/kg (`INF10`) at weeks 0, 2, and 6 then every 8 weeks * Filgotinib oral 100 mg once daily (`FIL100`) * Filgotinib oral 200 mg once daily (`FIL200`) * Golimumab subcutaneous 200 mg at week 0 and 100 mg at week 2 (`GOL200/100`) * Ozanimod oral 0.23 mg once daily for 4 days, 0.46 mg once daily for 3 days, then 0.92 mg once daily (`OZA0.92`) * Tofacitinib oral 10 mg twice daily for 8 weeks (`TOF10`) * Upadacitinib oral 45 mg once daily for 8 weeks (`UPA45`) * Ustekinumab intravenous 6 mg/kg at week 0 (`UST6`) * Vedolizumab intravenous 300 mg at weeks 0, 2, and 6 (`VED300`) The reference treatment is placebo (`PBO`). ::: {.cell tbl-cap='Efficacy outcomes (i.e., clinical remission) data of induction bio-na√Øve populations' hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_9c23db7041279ca4da9d5ed69c88f02c'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
studlab treat1 treat2 event1 n1 event2 n2
ACT-1 INF10 INF5 39 122 47 121
ACT-1 INF10 PBO 39 122 18 121
ACT-1 INF5 PBO 47 121 18 121
ACT-2 INF10 INF5 33 120 41 121
ACT-2 INF10 PBO 33 120 7 123
ACT-2 INF5 PBO 41 121 7 123
GEMINI 1 VED300 PBO 30 130 5 76
Japic CTI-060298 INF5 PBO 21 104 11 104
Jiang 2015 INF5 PBO 22 41 9 41
M10-447 ADA160/80 PBO 9 90 11 96
NCT01551290 INF5 PBO 11 50 5 49
NCT02039505 VED300 PBO 22 79 6 41
OCTAVE 1 TOF10 PBO 56 222 9 57
OCTAVE 2 TOF10 PBO 43 195 4 47
PURSUIT-SC GOL200/100 PBO 45 253 16 251
SELECTION FIL100 FIL200 47 277 60 245
SELECTION FIL100 PBO 47 277 17 137
SELECTION FIL200 PBO 60 245 17 137
TRUE NORTH OZA0.92 PBO 66 299 10 151
U-ACCOMPLISH UPA45 PBO 54 166 3 81
U-ACHIEVE Study 2 UPA45 PBO 41 145 4 72
ULTRA-1 ADA160/80 PBO 24 130 12 130
ULTRA-2 ADA160/80 PBO 32 150 16 145
UNIFI UST6 PBO 27 147 15 151
````` ::: ::: The corresponding network is displayed below: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_f0a92d7385e2bbc41332a55c7a54c96b'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Evidence network of 18 trials that contributed efficacy data for induction in bio-naive populations](chapter_10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Network meta-analysis Below, we conduct a random effects network meta-analysis of the reported study effects (expressed as odds ratio) and consider placebo (`treat = "PBO"`) as the control treatment. ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_b14ff4ed37c822e51841370713a292d1'} ```{.r .cell-code} NMA.uc <- netmeta(TE = TE, seTE = seTE, treat1 = treat1, treat2 = treat2, studlab = studlab, data = UlcerativeColitis, sm = "OR", ref = "PBO", comb.random = TRUE) ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_2bff19fe8eb4be9362ca97aca96fb111'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](chapter_10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: All treatments except `FIL100` and `UST6` are significantly more efficacious than `PBO` at inducing clinical remission. We can now estimate the probabilities of each treatment being at each possible rank and the SUCRAs (Surface Under the Cumulative RAnking curve): ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_08d229dba331acce03815c91e7c5f5d4'} ```{.r .cell-code} sucra.uc <- rankogram(NMA.uc, nsim = 100, random = TRUE, common = FALSE, small.values = "undesirable") # Exctract the SUCRA values sucra.uc$ranking.random ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` ADA160/80 FIL100 FIL200 GOL200/100 INF10 INF5 OZA0.92 0.28818182 0.18363636 0.45909091 0.61727273 0.58181818 0.75727273 0.73000000 PBO TOF10 UPA45 UST6 VED300 0.01545455 0.37000000 0.98181818 0.36636364 0.64909091 ``` ::: ::: These results indicate that 98.2% of evaluated treatments are worse than `UPA45`. ## COVID-19 ### Example Dataset ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_85909eebf794f09e56bb5bcc7c37181b'} ::: We have the following treatments: standard care (`treat = "STD"`), ... ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_fe6398e09b440d4d7dfec31394a5f2f4'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: ::: ### Network meta-analysis Below, we conduct a random effects network meta-analysis where we consider standard care (`treat = "STD"`) as the control treatment. ::: {.cell hash='chapter_10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_192eae6eb8c9553baa2da05ab618fd72'} ```{.r .cell-code} NMA.covid <- netmeta(TE = TE, seTE = seTE, treat1 = treat1, treat2 = treat2, studlab = studlab, data = covid, sm = "OR", ref = "STD", comb.random = TRUE) summary(NMA.covid) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Original data: treat1 treat2 TE seTE Abd-Elsalam et al HCQ STD 0.1933 0.6233 Biegel et al REM STD -0.3484 0.1851 Cao et al LOP+RIT STD -0.3390 0.3442 Cavalcanti et al HCQ STD 0.0269 1.4174 Davoudi-Monfared INT-B STD -0.9769 0.5126 Hermine et al STD TOCI 0.0813 0.5501 Horby et al DEXA STD -0.1512 0.0625 Lyngbakken et al HCQ STD -0.0392 1.4417 Recovery group LOP+RIT STD 0.0422 0.0718 Rohmani INT-B STD -1.2368 0.8579 Rosas et al STD TOCI -0.0180 0.2565 Salama et al STD TOCI -0.2152 0.3774 Salvarini et al STD TOCI -0.8071 1.2380 Solidarity trial-LR LOP+RIT STD -0.0066 0.1234 Solidarity trial - HCQ HCQ STD 0.1883 0.1547 Solidarity trial - Interferon INT-B STD 0.1326 0.0992 Solidarity trial - Remdesivir REM STD -0.0219 0.0863 Spinner et al REM STD -0.4674 0.6765 Stone et al STD TOCI -0.4442 0.6809 Tomazini et al DEXA STD -0.2148 0.2355 Ulrich et al HCQ STD 0.7915 0.5294 Veiga et al STD TOCI -0.9759 0.5244 Wang et al REM STD 0.0953 0.4093 Number of treatment arms (by study): narms Abd-Elsalam et al 2 Biegel et al 2 Cao et al 2 Cavalcanti et al 2 Davoudi-Monfared 2 Hermine et al 2 Horby et al 2 Lyngbakken et al 2 Recovery group 2 Rohmani 2 Rosas et al 2 Salama et al 2 Salvarini et al 2 Solidarity trial-LR 2 Solidarity trial - HCQ 2 Solidarity trial - Interferon 2 Solidarity trial - Remdesivir 2 Spinner et al 2 Stone et al 2 Tomazini et al 2 Ulrich et al 2 Veiga et al 2 Wang et al 2 Results (common effects model): treat1 treat2 OR 95%-CI Q Abd-Elsalam et al HCQ STD 1.2570 [0.9498;
